solution.item: At first we calculate the total resistance between the generator nodes (IS1)
R3 and R2 connected in series so Rb=R3+R2=4Ohm
R1 and Rb connected in parallel so Ra=R1*Rb/(R1+Rb)=1.33Ohm
Now we calculate the voltage on R2

We know that the voltage between IS1 nodes is 8.0V, because the generator current is Igen = 6A and the resistance between the generator nodes is Rtot = 1.33Ohm so the voltage between the generator nodes is Igen*Rtot = 8.0V
CGEN 'paralel' current calc on Rb, value: 2
CGEN 'paralel' voltage calc on Rb, value: 8

calculation.status: Fatal error: list index out of range
